headline: Seven-Layer Taco Dip
description: This taco dip has layers of refried beans, bell peppers, onion, Cheddar cheese, sour cream, and salsa. It's a great no-bake party appetizer.

video.description: See how to make a taco dip made with seven essential ingredients.
video.name: Seven Layer Taco Dip

name: Seven-Layer Taco Dip
recipeIngredient: 1 (6 ounce) can sliced black olives, drained

recipeInstructions.text: Blend refried beans and taco seasoning in a medium bowl; spread mixture onto a large serving platter.
Mix sour cream and cream cheese in a medium bowl; spread over refried beans.
Top with salsa. Layer tomato, bell pepper, green onions, and lettuce over top.
Sprinkle over Cheddar cheese and garnish with black olives.

review.reviewBody: 8 made th8s fo church function. They cleaned the platter. Absolutely like ivd that t!!
It was very easy to make, Delicious! Yum! Everyone always enjoys this recipe. I also omit the lettuce, it’s served warm from the oven Served with scoops , Tostitos
I Your friends will love it

Love the 7 layer dip. The only adjustment I make is I add hamburger with the taco seasoning on top of the beans, cooked as per pkg of seasoning. Was raised on it that way. Also, I don't add the cream cheese or green peppers. Tastes better that way.

I've made something similar, many times, but I put the taco seasoning in the sour cream/cream cheese mixture. That's what adds the flavor to the bland sour cream/cream cheese mixture. The beans should already have a good flavor, so no need to alter that. You can also buy the can of beans with jalapeno, or like me, I will use some homemade leftover beans, but I would definitely omit the bell peppers too. Not a flavor I want to taste in a dip like this. =) Then you can give this altered recipe a much better rating. Enjoy!
Green olives are my favorite, left out the creme cheese
We love this dish ! It's always a big hit !!
Added taco seasoning to beans and sour cream and cream cheese mixture. Added another layer of mild guacamole.
I added a chopped avocado and some chopped cilantro. I only used half the lettuce.

Try taco sauce instead of Salsa! I didn't have salsa and was in a pinch for time so I added regular/ original taco sauce drizzled. It was amazing! The taco sauce adds so much more flavor than just plain salsa. I also left off the green peppers and olives because of kids. I added black beans. This is one of the best recipes the way the layers are designed with seasoning with the beans and cream cheese add with sour cream. So good!

Somehow I didn’t find this recipe tasty and I normally love a 7-layer dip. Maybe it was the cream cheese? I’m not sure that’s a typical ingredient in a good 7- layer. At any rate, I’ll try a different recipe next time.

I made this for last years Super Bowl and it was a hit! I gave everyone their own glass cups, so no double dipping. LOL I made it exactly as described except I didn't have green onions so just used vadalia onions chopped also added a layer of guacamole. YUM!
I added a tsp of chili powder and a 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes to refried beans and this was awesome
Delicious. Terrific party dip. I served the dip with tortilla and pita chips. I followed the recipe exactly and it was a hit.
Easy and yummy!
We have made this several times. Always a big hit at gatherings.
My family loves this, a favorite of theirs and a requirement on Super Bowl Sunday. I agree that I use a bigger platter!

So I used to make this a long time ago. First I use 2 pack of cream cheese 1 pack of taco seasoning mix it together then put in a glass dish. Then put lettuce tomato’s and shredded cheese then put spoon fulls of sour cream n salsa n olives so great

This was really good. I don't have a large serving platter, so I used 13x9. I was concerned there wouldn't be enough beans to cover the bottom, so I added a little bit of salsa and it worked out perfectly. I did not add tomatoes or green pepper. I didn't think they were needed. I put the green onions on top of the cheese just because I like the look of them. We don't like olives so I didn't use those. This is a great recipe that you can make your own.
Delicious. Hard to stop eating this dip.
Seemed like too much of the sour cream mixture. Next time I would only use 3/4 of it
This dip is always a amazing . I change it up a bit... refried beans with jalapeño ... no green pepper! The lettuce never has time to wilt when I bring this to work... gone in 30 minutes!

Really liked this recipe, but felt it could have used some additional spice/flavor. I will make this again but will use more of the taco seasoning in both the beans and in the sour cream/cream cheese mix. I’ll also add some jalapeños to jazz it up. Overall, everyone loved it, the crunch of the shredded lettuce and creaminess of the sour cream & cream cheese was a hit!

I know this recipe called for using a clean bowl to mix the cream cheese and sour cream but I used my cereal bowl from this morning and my guests all complimented me on the hint of Coco-Puffs and banana it brought to the dish.

I think this is a great base recipe. I add ground beef to the refried bean mixture and mix in a bit of hot sauce and then add some taco seasoning to the cream cheese and sour cream mixture. We found it delicious scooped into a large flour tortilla with some tortilla chips crunched on top and the wrapped up and grilled. Its my favorite way to eat it. So good seriously.

Everyone loves this recipe! Instead of tomatoes, onion and green pepper I used a can of Rotel. I mixed the taco seasoning with the sour cream and cream cheese. I drained the salsa as it made the dip runny the first time I made it.
Just made this. Turned out really good. Did not use lettuce or black olives (preference). Might use homemade seasoning next time, but taco seasoning does the trick.

This was ok. Agree with some other reviewers, there is way too much dairy and the salsa made it too runny. Next time I’ll use half the dairy and strain the salsa. Also, missed the guacamole which next time I may use instead of the green pepper/green onion layer.

I would like to make a suggestion that I tried and loved! Like many others, omit the lettuce. Use half of the packet of taco seasoning to mix with the beans and the other half add to the sour cream and cream cheese mixture.

I made it for a pre-Thanksgiving meal the day before when family came to hang out. It was just OK and we ate it but it lacked the punch I'm used to. I couldn't find my usual recipe so I tried this one. Adding the cream cheese lessened the punch of the sour cream so I would take that out. I also made it in a pretty display bowl but would definitely adjust the layers because putting the tomatoes, peppers & salsa all together takes away the visual appeal you could get. I would also add in guacamole as a definite must. We just scooped it on top after the fact. Like I said it wasn't terrible but it could be made better.

I put mine in a 9 x 13 pan for a better fit. I cooked and drained a pound of hamburger beef. While on medium low, I added the taco seasoning and the refried beans. It blended well while it was still warm. I also only use 2/3 of the container of sour cream.?
I followed the recipe except I used whole red kidney beans instead of refried. I still mixed the kidney beans with taco mix and cooked a bit. My family loved it!

This was really good! I made this during the coronavirus quarantine, and the store was out of sour cream, so I subbed cottage cheese in its place. It actually worked out well! The one change I would make would be to double the salsa or add taco sauce. Make sure you are using a very large container for this because it could easily overflow!
Great Recipe

I made this exactly as written. The dish was very easy to put together. Everyone enjoyed it. I will make it again. The recipe made a lot more than I expected. I will use a larger platter next time, maybe 8"×12" or 9"×13".
This dish is nothing but the best to bring for a crowd. It is filling and delicious. Always appreciated.
This was really good, next time I will use (2) cans of refried beans and possibly a little less cream cheese - but overall yuuummmmy.

My whole family LOVED IT!!! It took a little longer than 15 minutes to make it but it turned out great. the only thing I changed was I used pepper jack cheese because I forgot to buy the cheddar cheese but I believe that made it better.
I followed the suggestion to use Rotel instead of the tomato and pepper. I drained the Rotel so it didn’t make my dish watery. The dip is delicious and and was a huge hit!
Perfect!! I omitted the things we don’t like. No need for bell peppers or onions. Added guacamole.
This is always a big hit at my office parties! So good, instead of a regular tomato I use the Rotel canned diced tomatoes and green chilies with it. It's delicious!
Added guacamole and omitted the lettuce and green pepper as other reviewers suggested. Topped the cheese with sliced black olives and jalapeños. Looks great!
Served at a wedding reception, received many raves, also great on game nights.

I love this dip!
Instead of using a full pack of taco mix in the beans, I use half and the remaining half in the sour cream. The green peppers add texture. I feel the cream cheese helps stabilize the sour cream. This recipe is always a winner!

So it’s a great base recipe. But I made an eight layer. And I took out the green pepper or lettuce. I started with the beans I used black refried beans. Than I mixed the sour cream cream cheese together and spread it evenly.then I added chopped tomatoes then a layer of homemade guacamole. I then added salsa then black olives and topped it all off with sharp cheddar and green onions. Loved it so delicious ??
This turned out Great! But I will not add a whole package of taco seasoning next time. Also you will need a large patter or lasagna pan to hold it all.

I always get rave reviews for this one - it's so easy to assemble and such a crowd pleaser! My layer is as such: beans with the taco seasoning; cream cheese and sour cream; salsa; guacamole; lettuce with cilantro and green onion; cheese; black olives.
Had made something similar before, but the creme cheese in this recipe really kicked it up a notch. Easy to make and NO leftovers!! Will make it again for sure!

My family loves this dip. I have made it for years. The only change I make is by adding the taco seasoning to the sour cream/cream cheese mixture. It definitely spreads the seasoning out more and everyone raves over it!

Prepared the refried bean/taco seasoning, sour cream/cream cheese layers night before, morning of event added rest of ingredients. The only thing I didn't add was the black olives as I don't like them. Definitely going to make again. Served with nacho chips. Even better day 2.

Excellent and very easy to make. I did change it a bit. Left out the cream cheese, added some taco seasoning to the sour cream layer and swapped the lettuce for guacamole. It was very good and received lots of praise from co-workers.
everyone loved it
very good. all eaten within 20 minutes

This is a very good basic recipe that can easily be tweaked to your own liking. 
One reviewer stated that cream cheese doesn't belong in this dip. Well, I suppose not if you're trying to make authentic Mexican, but I think the creaminess is what makes this dish. It balances nicely with the robust flavor of the taco seasoning, tomatoes, onions, and olives.
Next time I will add a layer of guacamole.
This would go nicely with black beans and corn also.
I made this for football game night get together with family. Everyone loved it.
Amazingly good
Salsa made it a little too runny. Will try not to add so much next time.
easy, yummy, definitely a crowd pleaser

this turned out really good-I did mix the beans and taco mix with a mixer because it wasn't blending very well.
The end result with fresh vegetables was delicious!

Great dip!! I used a 9x13 pan and thought at first that it would be too big because recipe called for a large serving platter.Nope, perfect size and if I used all the ingredients this called for, it wouldn’t fit. I used 1/2 head of lettuce and 1 cup of hand grated Colby Jack cheese because that’s what I had on hand. Very tasty and I like how my vegetarian friends can enjoy it, too.
This is a great go to recipe for parties! My adult children and their friends love this one!
I have made this a few times now and every time my guests LOVE it. I never have leftovers! This recipe has been added to my "tried & true" collection.

I love this recipe! I brought this to a drama potluck as well as just ate it at home and everyone loved it and kept going back for more! I personally didn't put the olives on because I don't like them. The first time I made it, I didn't put very much lettuce on because I was worried about it wilting, but I found it too cheesy. The second time I made it, I put on the whole head of lettuce (or, most of it) and it was much better and didn't even wilt! I also discovered that it doesn't really matter what type of bell pepper you use because no one can tell the difference anyways, so just use whatever you have on hand! Definitely recommend trying it!

This is the perfect base recipe. I left off the lettuce, green peppers & tomatoes (it has salsa!). One thing I did was drain my salsa before adding it to the dip. I was concerned that it would make the dip watery. Just depends on how much liquid your salsa has. This is a recipe that you can adjust to your liking. There was not a bite left! Will definitely use this recipe again.
I just made this for dinner, and my family absolutely loves it! Next time I might add some jalapenos just to add some spice.
We are very social and I made this one time... it is requested at every event we attend. Matter of fact one husband gives me money to make a batch just for him!
left out lettuce and peppers, added Luv Ann's Guac
I loved this taco dip! My family did as well!
I made this for book club and it was a hit! so delicious and easy to make!!!

Missing avocado, but otherwise soooo good!
Great to throw on a flour tortilla & create a yummy burrito!

This is probably my favorite nacho/taco dip I've ever made. It was really easy and made a HUGE amount, perfect for a big family snack or a party. The addition of the taco seasoning to the refried beans gave a tasty kick. I will definitely make this again. Great on chips or rolled up in a warm burrito wrap!
This recipe is good as is or I sometimes add burger. Would be good with jalapeños for the "spicy" people.
We all loved it!

This didn’t wow. Not enough dimension. Some people thought the lettuce layer was unusual. I think I should of drained the salsa as it made the dip sort of runny. I made this recipe as written. It was good but not great.
It's very good as is. We did not add olives (although it would make a nice garnish) out of preference.
I make this for many of the parties I attend and it’s always a hit! It’s so simple to make and I always have these items on hand! Yum!

I removed the bell pepper, replaced the lettuce with Guacamole and put the taco seasoning on a pound of ground beef. 

I layered it bottom first as follows:

Beans
Sour Cream/Cream Cheese mix
Taco Seasoned Ground Beef
Salsa
Guacamole
Tomatoes
Cheese 
Green Onions and Black Olives on top.

I actually made it the night before to let the flavors sit in a little and it was awesome. More filling than you would think.
I added a layer of guacamole, skipped the lettuce
This was really good. I substituted black beans for the olives.

i did the following and everyone LOVED it. said it could be a dish on its own:
- no black olives
- no green onions
- sub cowboy caviar for salsa (found in the salsa section at Lidl. main ingredients are corn and black beans)

I made this recipe in lieu of buying a dip for an anniversary party. I doubled the batch and did it on a 16" square heavy duty plastic tray... good idea on the heavy duty LOL. I bought the restaurant-style refried beans and mixed with taco seasoning. Then a layer of the cream cheese/sour cream, topped with cooked taco meat, then chunky salsa that I had drained, then olives, green onions, and cheese. I knew it would be sitting out so I opted out of lettuce and thought that if I did salsa AND tomatoes, that would be a bit overkill. I had the taco meat to use, that's why I threw it in. I know, don't rate it if you didn't make it exactly like the recipe and I completely agree. In this case though, I went searching specifically for this recipe knowing what ingredients I had and was going to use, and this dip was gone by the end of the evening.
I left out the olives and used red bell pepper instead of green, but I've eaten a dip like this before, and it's good either way!
I will make it again, very good
I make this every year for Christmas BUT I leave out the lettuce. It makes a perfect dip that pretty much everyone can enjoy!
very good!!!!!
I made this for Super Bowl Sunday. My whole family absolutely loved it!
It was all eaten within the first half of the game

Don’t think you need cream cheese and sour cream. I would skip the cream cheese. Another review suggested leaving iff the green pepper. After using the green pepper maybe leaving it off would be better.

Great! I used a yellow pepper instead of a green one and omitted the iceberg lettuce. Also added a nice layer of green chiles before the salsa step which gave it a nice kick! Pickled jalapeños could be added too depending on how much you like heat! Love that it’s meatless. It’s a great party food for vegetarians who might not have another option.
made this several times and will be making it again for the Super Bowl!!
Yes, I changed a few things based on Reading the other reviews ... but the poor dip didn’t have a chance, gone within twenty minutes! I was told that I need to make two next time! ????
Really great dip! I added some seasoning to the refried beans and sprinkled some chopped up avacado on top.
My family loved this dip. I did make some changes. I substituted Neufachel cheese for the cream cheese and poblano and ancho chilis for the bell pepper. It was excellent!

Great first three layers for a base, but I omitted tomatoes and lettuce and added avocado to make my 7 layers: beans, cream cheese mixture, salsa, sliced olives, cheese, diced avocado, chopped green onions. Totally done in less than 30 minutes. A couple suggestions: try using refried black beans. I also used plain Greek yogurt instead of sour cream.
Excellent Dip. VERY Flavorful. Thank you for this wonderful recipe!
Every time I make this I double the recipe and that is usually still not enough. Everyone loves it.

This dip was amazing! I took it to work for s carry-in and didn't bring a drop home. The only thing I might do a little different (and this is simply a taste preference) I would use more beans...and like a lot of others I didn't use green pepper. I didn't want to turn up the heat for folks at work, but for home I'm going to add some fresh jalapenos.
Make this & it was a huge hit! I omitted the green pepper bc I hate green pepper. I added premade guacamole from Aldi between the white & salsa layers. Delicious!!!
This is in my regular rotation for any gathering now... sans olives, only because I don't like them.
